results.title: Street of shame = Akasen chitai [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Janus Films, Daiei Motion Picture Company, Masaichi Nagata and Kenji Mizoguchi
results.brief_description: The setting is a Tokyo brothel, ironically called Dreamland. The content is the thoughts, disappointments and aspirations of the occupants. This was Mizoguchi’s final film, and one in which he returned to his earlier theme of the exploitation of women throughout the ages. He does so by integrating the stories of five prostitutes which covers the roles of women as daughters, mothers and wives. Many believe that this film was pivotal in the 1957 decision to abolish prostitution in Japan. Cast includes Daisuke Kato, Machiko Kyo and Aiko Mimasu.

results.title: Street musique
results.brief_description: Visual improvisation on music performed by a popular group presented as sidewalk entertainers. The illustration is by a young film artist and animator who sees life with an amused and imaginative eye. His take-off point is the music, but his own beat is more boisterous than the musicians. He ranges from the most convoluted of abstractions to caricature of familiar rituals, including the bath. Photography by Pierre Provost, Cameron Gaul, Simon Leblanc. Music by Rick Scott, Dick Tarnoff, Rick Stone, Rick Watson, Jim Colby and Jon Van Arsdell. Sound by Roland Newton. (Five awards: including Oberhausen and Melbourne.)

results.title: Street life in Tehran
results.brief_description: A compilation of three short Iranian films all shot in Tehran and each purveying through its images, streetscapes of life and human behaviour at chosen moments in time. Independent and individual as each of these three films are, they also provide a juxtaposition to one another and an engaging focus on human interaction and reaction. “Deadtime” - An amusing look at what people do when they are stuck in congested city traffic with the traffic lights jammed on red. Close-up images of patient drivers, restless children, bored passengers and the various activities which take place to fill in the ticking minutes that appear to be turning into never-ending hours. No dialogue but contains street sounds and background music. “The White station” - In total contrast with “Deadtime”, this film presents a stark and isolated situation caused through a severe snow storm where a few brave and lonely souls are waiting for the arrival of the Tehran public transport system to pick them up. Evocative filming with just the sound of the wind and snow, interspersed with the occasional bird-life, simplistic and intriguing. No dialogue. “Tehran: the 25th hour” - On 29 November 1998 the return match of Iran and Australia for the World Cup 1998 was televised in Tehran live from Melbourne. Iran qualified and the quiet urban streets of Tehran soon transformed into mad scenes of jubilation and celebration, people everywhere of all ages joining in cheering and dancing, lining the streets on foot and in their cars. Two days later see this same mad passionate crowd contained in the Azadi Grand Stadium to welcome home their heroes - united and jubilant these fans are one. In Farsi with English subtitles.

results.title: Street Hero
results.brief_description: Vince Colosimo is a young guy living in a world of drugs, illegal gambling and cruising cop cars. The only thing that keeps him above the mire of petty criminals is his music. The guy’s a drummer in a school band. He’s got the chance to improve his status in the local “Mafia” and they’re pushing for a decision, “Vinnie, you either go it alone, or you join us and get on in the world.”

results.title: Street fighter II: the animated movie
results.creator_credit: Capcom Productions, Kenichi Imai and Gisaburo Sugii
results.brief_description: Based on the popular video game of the same name. Human civilisation is under attack in the not so distant future. Bison is the evil mastermind who leads the forces of evil and wants to take possession of the world’s best fighters so he can use them to conquer the world. Ken and Ryu are the only two humans in the world with the skill and strength to stop them. What ensues is a mighty battle in the classic clash between the forces of good and evil.

results.title: Street angels
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Kim Dalton, Alison Nisselle and Kathy Mueller
results.brief_description: Chrissie is fifteen, homeless and fighting for survival on the street. She desperately needs someone she can trust to give her the chance to claw her way out. Martin and Graham are social workers who run a half-way house in Nelson Street for the kinds of kids that nobody else wants. They’re only too familiar with the dark underbelly of damaged childhoods, so they are surrogate parents to six kids like them. Chrissie is friends with one of the kids from the home. She hovers in the orbit of the group home and she’s almost tempted in the door, until one provocative act lands her back in the hands of the law. She manages to destroy every gain she’s made and Martin is left to pick up the pieces. Conceived and written by one of Australia’s most experienced scriptwriters, Emmy-nominated Alison Nisselle, “Street angels’ is a touching portrayal of the difficulties of being a street kid in Australia.

results.title: Streams of our city
results.creator_credit: Filmpartnership and Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works
results.brief_description: For the people and industry of Melbourne, the rivers and streams of the city are as important today as they were to the first settlers. However little thought was given to their character and natural purpose as draining systems. Neglect has inevitably led to deterioration. This film shows some of the problems and ways of overcoming them.

results.title: Streamlines
results.creator_credit: BBC, Time Inc and James Kent
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “American visions”.
This episode covers American art and architecture from the Wall Street Crash to the eve of the Second World War. Even as Manhattan was on the verge of the Depression, the skyscraper reigned supreme. “New York’s shifting, rising skyline was like nothing Europe had ever seen”, notes Hughes, as he outlines Art Deco and describes the construction of the Chrysler Building and the Empire State Building. FDR’s New Deal employed artists through the WPA (Works Progress Administration), which itself was the center of controversy when Diego Rivera had his left-wing fresco painted over by capitalist tycoon John D. Rockefeller. Major projects such as the Hoover Dam, representing “a rallying symbol for American self-confidence, so bruised and battered by the Great Depression,” were constructed. Urban artists such as Jacob Lawrence, Edward Hopper and Stuart Davis are featured. In the American Midwest, artists evoked a more conservative perspective, depicting idyllic scenes of rural and farm life. Highly innovative design was used to sell consumers a modern lifestyle. This movement culminated with the exhibition dedicated to the modern machine, the New York World’s Fair of 1939, which is remembered today as the last burst of utopian belief in the machine before the destruction left by the military technology of World War II. Written and presented by Robert Hughes.

results.title: Streamers
results.creator_credit: Rank Film Productions, Streamers International, Nick Mileti and Robert Altman
results.brief_description: Set in an Army barracks in 1965, a group of young soldiers wait assignment to Vietnam. The draftees come from diverse backgrounds: two are afro-americans, one a country boy and the other a Yale-educated homosexual. They are confronted by two brutal ex-Korean war veteran sergeants. Sexual and racial tensions build as the men wait in their claustrophobic barracks but eventually shocking violence erupts. The barracks is a microcosm of the explosive emotions and issues which surfaced in America at that time, however the theatrical nature of the original material, (based on a play by David Rabe) is reflected in a static production which is more stagebound than fluid. The performances, especially by Matthew Modine, Michael Wright and George Dzundza are superb.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rank Film Productions, Streamers International, Nick Mileti and Robert Altman

results.title: Stream
results.creator_credit: Crawley Films, International Film Bureau and Kenneth Campbell
results.brief_description: Examines through seasonal changes and by following the course of a flowing water system, the two basic types of stream environments - erosional and depositional habits.
